teaspoon.adaptation

Class BhattMethod

  • java.lang.Object
    • teaspoon.adaptation.BhattMethod

  • public class BhattMethod
extends java.lang.Object
    TEASPOON: Tools for Evolutionary Analysis of Serially-sampled POpulatiONs Jayna Raghwani, Samir Bhatt, Joe Parker & Oliver G. Pybus University of Oxford, 2010-2018.

    BhattMethod is a class for counting of synonymous (silent) and nonsynonymous (replacement) polymorphisms to obtain site-frequency class information to calculate neutral rates of evolution and numbers of adaptive substitutions.

    It includes methods to obtain observed changes by fractional counting, expected changes by probabalistic sampling, and utility methods.

    Since:
    5 Jun 2018
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    @jnarag, @lonelyjoeparker
    See Also:
    Raghwani et al (2016) for details

        public double[] calculateSiteFrequenciesWithinInterval(double u,
                                                       double v,
                                                       double[] prior,
                                                       boolean needPrior)
        calculates a silentProb and replacement site frequency between ranges u and v
        Parameters:
        u -
        v -
        prior -
        needPrior -
        Returns:
        double[] list of data: silentProb count [0]; replacement count [1]; total count [2]; total variant [3]; total invariant [4]

      • calculateSiteFrequenciesWithinIntervalNG

                                                         double v,
                                                         double[] prior,
                                                         boolean needPrior)
        calculates a silentProb and replacement site frequency between ranges u and v

        Note: From Samir Bhatt's thesis pp. 145 (Discussion, section 5.4); seems like this used the Nei & Gojobori (1986) counting method.

        Parameters:

        v -
        prior -
        needPrior -

      • inferCountsEstimatedNR

        public void inferCountsEstimatedNR(double[][] binsvalues,
                                   double[] prior,
                                   boolean needPrior,
                                   boolean[] which)
        Runs the Bhatt counting method, neutral rate will be estimated. Prior for the binomial is usually assumed to be beta[1,1]. See Raghwani et al (2016)
        Parameters:
        binsvalues - - site frequency bin ranges
        prior - - parametise the beta distribution as prior for the binomial sampler
        needPrior -
        which -

      • inferCountsFixedNR

        public void inferCountsFixedNR(double[][] binsvalues,
                               double[] prior,
                               boolean needPrior,
                               boolean[] which,
                               double NR)
                        throws NullNeutralRatioException
        The Bhatt probabalistic counting method; neutral rate is fixed. Prior for the binomial is usually assumed to be beta[1,1]. See Raghwani et al (2016)
        Parameters:
        binsvalues - - site frequency bin ranges
        prior - - parametise the beta distribution as prior for the binomial sampler
        needPrior -
        which -
        NR - - the fixed neutral (replacement:silent) ratio for the mid-frequency site class
        Throws:
        NullNeutralRatioException
